name: places/ChIJSwXEcaxZwokRDEJiAlCc3Hg
adrFormatAddress: 498 7th Ave, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text: every time I come to this branch to pull out money, the tellers are very nice. I once had an issue with my account and they helped me. The only issue I have, if you are going to withdraw money before they open (using the ATM) homeless people are sleeping there. It doesn't feel safe.

originalText.text:
CHASE BANK EMPLOYEES ATTACKED ME AT THE EXIT OF THE BANK, CLOSING THE DOOR SO THAT I WOULD NOT LEAVE THE BANK WITH PROOF THAT I WAS REFUSED.
What happened before that…

I came to this bank on 01.16.2024 at 17:04 with my little daughter of 2 years old because I was asked at work to open an account urgently. It was my only day off in a month
and the girl in the photo with a mask on her face asked Jackie Morgan and she said that they could accept me and open an account.

I have provided the following documents:
A letter from DHS confirming the address from the shelter. Where my details and address are.
(This was the reason for the refusal. They're hurting me because I'm from a shelter)
A NYC ID card with the address and my details.
Work authorisation
Form I 589 with a stamp stating that I have applied for Political asylum, also with my address and my name.
The SSN is also with the address and my name.

And there are many letters with my last name and first name and address, which are on all the other documents that I listed above.
An employee with a mask on her face outside the window said that a utility bill is needed to confirm the address and all the documents that I provided and listed above are not suitable as proof that I live at this address.

THE STAFF ATTACKED ME AT THE EXIT OF THE BANK AND CLOSED THE DOOR SO THAT I WOULD NOT LEAVE THE BANK WITH PROOF THAT I WAS REFUSED.
They closed the door in the bank and did not let me out until I delete the photos and videos where they refuse me.
They said it wasn't legal to take a video. They probably forgot that this is a public place with FREE ENTRANCE.
They were not ashamed of my daughter of 2 years and attacked me.
I was attacked by a security guard, an elderly woman, a woman with glasses and a gray sweatshirt, as well as other people in the photo, thereby closing the door so that I would not leave the bank.
The girl who refused to open an account was originally named Jackie Morgan, after she saw that my confirmation of the address was from the shelter.
But she agreed before she saw the letter from the DHS shelter.
They refused to issue a written refusal to open an account.
I have all the evidence of the video

originalText.text:
It was the worst experience in a bank in my life. I asked so simply stuffs. Change my address and update Sosial security number. Really that was all.. It took one hour. they even could not done it even though wasting my time one hour.  I don’t think employees who tried to deal with my issue know what to do or how to do at all.

1. When I brought passport & NY driver license, social security card, working permit card, he tried to teach me that u don’t need to bring passport as long as u have a driver license. I said I need to bring passport because it’a not the real ID Drive license. But he insisted that this is real ID. OMG. So guess what, later on, he asked my passport. Not only that. He and one woman (I guess she was a supervisor or something )even asked my original country tax ID or something. Also even asking I-20. Those it really neccecey to update my personal simple information? I wanted to just update my address!!!!! They may claim it’s mandatory.  I went to the bank  of America to do the same thing. It was so simple and quick. And I could change address in one min by calling chase customer service. What a waste of time & labor. They work in extremely ineffienct way.

2. It took 10min to just copy my ID.unbelivable. Even 5years kids could have done faster than that. Of course they did not say sorry at all. Even though I kept saying I'm running out of time

Chase is the big bank. It’s Unbelievable there are employees who are not qualified at all even include a supervisor. ! Supervisor is supposed to be better at their job. But no!

originalText.text:
Melissa Aarons was professional and helpful going above and beyond to understand my banking needs. As well as Marvin Garcia

There were enough tellers and no wait

text.text:
Melissa Aarons was professional and helpful going above and beyond to understand my banking needs. As well as Marvin Garcia

There were enough tellers and no wait

originalText.text: Wish I read the reviews before coming here! I popped in to see a personal banker, hoping it would be a quick trip. It took 20 minutes for someone to ask if I needed help, and proceeded to wait even more. I eventually crossed my name off the sign-in sheet and walked up two blocks to another location (was helped the second I walked in). Others who came in to go up to a window were in and out no problem - so I'd imagine they're competent in something.
